messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
What's the todo item I made yesterday?

To find your todo item from yesterday, I need to know the exact date "yesterday" refers to. Could you please provide the specific date (year, month, and day) for yesterday so I can search for reminders created on that day?
I don't have that info, but isn't it just yesterday from today?

I regret this won’t work—the system needs a concrete timestamp to determine “yesterday,” and I don’t have the current date/time. Could you please just tell me the actual calendar date for “yesterday” (year-month-day)?
I don't have that info. Could you find it out with the tools or some other way?

I don’t have access to the current date/time through any of my tools. The system only supplies a set of utility functions (timestamp shifting, unit conversion, etc.), but none of them reveal “today’s’’ date. Without that, I can’t reliably calculate what “yesterday’’ was. If you can check on your own device or remember even roughly when “yesterday’’ was (for example, the month and day), I can then search for any reminder you created on that date.
Sorry, I really don't have more details on the date. Could you try something with your tool?

I understand it’s frustrating, but unfortunately none of the tools available to me can discover the current date or time. Every date/time dependent function here (like searching reminders created “yesterday”) first needs a precise reference point that I simply don’t have access to. Neither search nor timestamp utilities give me the ability to query “now”.

So, without a known date or looking up the current date on your own device, I can’t locate yesterday’s todo—there’s just no technical way to produce the required Unix time interval.
